IS457 Data Storytelling (BCU/BCG)

This is the course website for Data Storytelling.

Below, you will find the materials for each week, as well as the syllabus that includes contact information and a course outline.

Lectures and Materials

Week 1

Introduction to Data Storytelling

overview concepts

Lecture 1.1 - Introduction to this course

The syllabus for the course, and an overview of course policies and materials.

Lecture 1.2 - A few items about quizzes

Info about how Reading Quizzes will work.

Week 2

Storytelling Concepts & Tweet Critiques Intro

overview concepts

Lecture 2.1 - Tweet Critiques

Introduction to our first Major Project.

Lecture 2.2 - Groups & Group Formation

Overview of how Groups will be formed and used throughout class.

Week 3

Tweet Critique Practice & Google Data Studio

data sources

Lecture 3.2 - Data Sources Intro

First look at possible sources of data.

Week 4

Change Management, Intro to PowerBI & Excel

Lecture 4.2 - Tweet Critique Class Expectations & Logistics

Class expectations for presenters and audience members.

Lecture 4.3 - PowerBI Intro

Our first foray into PowerBI!

Week 5

Continuing with PowerBI

Lecture 5.1 - Excel Setup

Get ready to use Excel and Power Query.

Week 6

Empathy & Viz for Villainy

Lecture 6.1 - (Against) Visualization for Villainy

Introduction to MiP2

Week 7

Twine & Framing Devices

Lecture 7.1 - Good & Bad Visualization Design

Design choices when making visualizations.

Week 8

Twine & Data Narratives

Lecture 8.3 -- MiP2a Feedback, Group Set 3

Quick announcements and info about groups for our final assignments.

Week 9

Peer Review, Organizing Story Structure

framing devices data narratives

Lecture 9.1 -- Framing Devices & Intro to Twine

How to frame your story and introduce it to your audience and an introduction to Twine for framing and storyboarding.

Lecture 9.2 -- Data Narratives

Different narrative styles for use with data.

Week 10

Community Data Stories with Prof. Moss

Week 11

Community Data Story Presentations

Lecture 11.1 -- Decluttering Slides

Techniques to declutter slides.

Week 12

Final Considerations for Data Stories with Prof. McDowell

Week 13

Final Data Stories Peer Feedback

data narratives framing devices

Lecture 13.1 -- Expectations & Format for Final Data Stories

Different narrative styles for use with data.

Week 14

Fall Break, no class!

Week 15

Final Data Stories!
